name: Banjo Baby Necklace
description: "Daddy played the banjo, ‘neath the yellow tree, It rang across the backyard, an old time melody, I loved to hear the music, I was only five, I listened as his fingers made the banjo come alive." BUG POP is a long-time lover of the Bluegrass and Old-Time sounds thanks to Poppa B and his collection of folk instruments and records back in the 80s! Now we are blessed with a thriving scene in BUG POPs own hometown, Liverpool, England. With "The Loose Moose String Band" at The Caleedonia Pub fortnightly Sundays, and "Sidney Bailey's No-Good Punchin' Clowns" AND "The Flamin' Mamies" every Tuesday at Peter Kavannaghs (Check out all of those bands, they NEVER dissapoint!), there is now a thriving buzzing throng of appreciators of that ol' country music, and plenty of chances to dance! "And if ya don't wanna just up an' dance when ya hear the Banjo player pickin', then there's sumthin wrong with either y'ears or boots or both!" DID YOU KNOW?: A banjo originally had a square body. However, due to the need to play it whilst resting the body on their knee, the musicians began to add on extra "wings" to create a circular shape. Over time, those who manufactured the banjo decided to simply change the overall shape. Materials: Wood and Vinyl Miniature, Gold Nickel-Free Chain

name: Dickensian Darling Locket
description: "Electric communication will never be a substitute for the face of someone who with their soul encourages another person to be brave and true." Charles Dickens, born in Portsmouth in 1812, was the well-loved British author of countless literary classics including Oliver Twist, A Christmas Carol, Nicholas Nickleby, David Copperfield, A Tale of Two Cities and Great Expectations. Dickens died suddenly in 1870 leaving his final novel, The Mystery of Edwin Drood, unfinished. Although a kind-hearted and upright man, Dickens was brilliantly weird, advocating Hypnotism, keeping a pet Raven who he had stuffed when it died, keenly attending paranormal investigation "ghost clubs" in London, and having to sleep with his head pointing north every night owing to his OCD! Could he get any cooler?... Read the DID YOU KNOW?! ... WE LOVE YOU CHARLES! DID YOU KNOW?: In 1846 Dickens co-founded Urania Cottage, a home for the redemption of “fallen” women where accepted candidates could learn skills, often domestic, and re-integrate into society. Materials: 1.5 Inch Gold Plated engraved Cameo Locket, Gold Plated Nickel-Free Chain

name: Mini Minnie Necklace
description: "I'm giving you a haircut, Walking to the sushi bar." Try and bear with us for this one... When designed, this piece was imagined in a mind-warping scale setting... These littele guys are real-man-sized humans, gorging themselves on GIANT sushi, in a Land Of The Giants type adventure. They and the sushi have just been shrunk down to the perfectly dinky wearable size for our pleasure! Geddit?! Like it?! ... Thought so! ;-) DID YOU KNOW?: The mass-production of sushi rolls was made possible by a pioneering female scientist in Britain in the 1940s. Japanese seaweed farmers have erected a shrine in her memory. Materials: Miniature Plastic Models, Nickel Free Chain

artists.name: Land Of The Giants Sushi House

name: Audrey Beaded Bracelet
description: "Baubles, bangles, hear how they jing, jinga-linga Baubles, bangles, bright shiny beads" This beaded bracelet is part of a collection of unique one-of-a-kind pieces. Featuring beads bought during travels allover Europe, each one is special and cannot be repeated! Showcasing a cuter-than-cute dolls house tin can replica just tops it off! DID YOU KNOW?: The word bracelet comes from the Latin brachiale: 'belonging to the arm'. Materials: Elastic thread, Vintage and Modern Glass, Plastic, and Ceramic Beads Comes complete with BUG POP One-Of-A-Kind Certificate

name: Jaws Kilt Pin Brooch
description: "We're gonna need a bigger boat!" One of the greatest monster movies of all time, easily winning its place in BUG POP's top ten films, it's JAWS!!! This charm brooch features a vintage enamel replica of a majestic Great White, a sailboat's bell, a sea-ripple blue stone heart, ship's wheel, and drapes of chain. Wether you love the sea, or can't dip a toe in it without hearing THAT two-note tune, this brooch will be a great conversation starter worn on a dress, coat, or bag! DID YOU KNOW?: The largest white shark reliably measured was a 6.0 m (19.7 ft) individual reported from Ledge Point, Western Australia in 1987! Materials: 2.5 Inch Silver Plated Kilt Pin, Metal and Enamel Charms, Plated Metal Chains, Polished Stone Bead LIMITED EDITION - FIVE IN THE WORLD - Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate!

name: Eye Eye Necklace
description: "Got hell looking up, heaven looking down, People say the woman's got an evil eye." The protective "Evil Eye" charm is a widely popular charm in jewellery history. Maybe most commonly recognized is the Turkish "Nazar Boncuk" charm - an "eye" set on a blue background - but the eye worn as a form of personal protection is also a prevalent part of the folk histories of Mexico, Africa, and the Mediteranean. It is believed that the worn eye deflects ill-meaning stares and dark wishes, to keep you safe from harm. This dolls eye is set in a folky gold-tone frame depicting birds and woven-twigs. Hung on an 18 inch sturdy gold chain. DID YOU KNOW?: Ashkenazi Jews in Europe and the Americas routinely exclaim Keyn aynhoreh!, meaning "No evil eye!" in Yiddish, to ward off a jinx after something or someone has been rashly praised or good news has been spoken aloud! Materials: 1 Inch Plastic Eye, Gold tone frame, Gold tone Nickel-Free chain

name: Delft Windmill Plate Brooch
description:
"Windmill, windmill, keep on turning; Show me the way, take me today ! " Delftware is the general name given to that famous 16th century Blue and White ceramic style from the Dutch City of Delft. Authentic Delftware is hand painted by artists and tin glazed by a process developed over the centuries.
This little replica Delft plate is the perfect lapel pin, with a perfect balance of teaparty-class and souvenir-trash! DID YOU KNOW?: In 1979 Werner Herzog used the town square of Delft for Lucy Harker's nightmarish plague scene in his revisiting of the 1922 silent classic, Nosferatu. Materials: 1.5 Inch Ceramic Plate

name: Mr Roboto Necklace
description: "You're wondering who I am, machine or mannequin, with parts made in Japan, I am the modren man!" Robots are one of BUG POP's all-time favourite subjects! From the sharp-cornered retro beauty of the Robot-film-stars of the golden era, to the freakish realism of modern-day humanoids. The robot on this necklace is a likeness of Robby, the space-bot from the 1956 film Forbidden Planet. At his right hand is a golden jolt of electricity to keep him charged, and keep everyone's eyes firmly on your decolletage! DID YOU KNOW?: In 1939 "Elektro", the world’s first humanoid robot, was debuted. He was seven-foot-tall, walked and spoke more than 700 words. Elektro later appeared in the 1960 B movie Sex Kittens Go to College! Materials: 16 Inch Silver Plated Chain, Gold and Silver tone Enamel Charms LIMITED EDITION - TWENTY FIVE - Comes complete with numbered BUG POP Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate

name: Moon Dog Keyring
description: "And I'm floating in a most peculiar way, and the stars look very different today. " Aboard the Soviet's Sputnik 2, a dog named Laika became the very first living creature to enter orbit. However, since the Soviets did not create a re-entry plan, Laika died in space, sparking debates about animal rights around the world. To us she is the mascot of all the heroic animals that were thrust into space without a choice! Take her with you as a reminder of the animals that still die testing things out before us humans try them on our own kind! DID YOU KNOW?: Other animals to make historic flights into space include Cats, Monkeys, Mice, Fish, Crickets, Spiders, Frogs, Harvester Ants! Materials: 1 Inch Picture Cameo, Silver tone Keyring, Gold tone charm pendant

name: Dinky Dinah Necklace
description: "I'm giving you a haircut, Walking to the sushi bar." Try and bear with us for this one... When designed, this piece was imagined in a mind-warping scale setting... These littele guys are real-man-sized humans, gorging themselves on GIANT sushi, in a Land Of The Giants type adventure. They and the sushi have just been shrunk down to the perfectly dinky wearable size for our pleasure! Geddit?! Like it?! ... name: Sushi Party Salmon Pin
description: "Huzzah, Huzzah, for the sushi bar!" All the fun of a Sushi feast for fairies, with none of the mess! This pin dangles and drips with bright coloured shiny sushi dinner replica. Made from mixed and matched rare and collectible sets of miniature sushi meals, direct from Japan, these ONE-OFF EDITIONS are the hight of Kitsch! Wear this for a hot date, or to try and encourage fish-loving fairies to land on your lapel to sample your tempting wares. DID YOU KNOW?: The mass-production of sushi rolls was made possible by a pioneering female scientist in Britain in the 1940s. Japanese seaweed farmers have erected a shrine in her memory. Materials: Miniature Plastic Models, Chain, Safety Pin Brooch

DID YOU KNOW?: The word bracelet comes from the Latin brachiale: 'belonging to the arm'. artists.name: Land Of The Giants Sushi House

name: The Dashing Mr Darcy Cameo
description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you!" Let's hear it for Jane Austen's original G.E.N.T! - Mister Fitzwilliam Darcy... well-mannered, intelligent, prompt, well-dressed, cool-headed, respectful, wealthy, AND he could dance! Darcy's will they, won't they routine with Elizabeth Bennet deflects the often unattainably instantaneous "love at first sight" notion which we fairy tales and disney films have taught us to seek out. In Pride And Prejudice, the two awkward romantic leads waver, doubt and question their interest in each other for what seems like forever, until he clears his throat and declares his love. And THEN they live happily ever after! DID YOU KNOW?: Whilst writing about the imagined happiness of Miss Bennet and Darcy, Jane Austen accepted a marriage proposal, only to change her mind the next morning! Materials: 1.5 Inch Gold Plated engraved Cameo Locket, Gold Plated Nickel-Free Chain

artists.name: Land Of The Giants Sushi House

name: Shakespearian Sweetheart Locket
description:
"Love looks not with the eyes but with the mind." William Shakespeare, "Bard of Avon", is rightly one of the countrys greatest treasures. His surviving works consist of around 38 plays, 154 sonnets, and countless other poems. His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright. And what teenage girl didn't dissappear into Romeo And Juliet for a while circa "Year 7 English Lit"? Not to mention Claire Danes, Leo, and THAT fishtank scene! *swoon!* This one of his sonnets seemed apt to this trinket treasure...
"Mine eye hath played the painter and hath steeled, Thy beauty's form in table of my heart; My body is the frame wherein 'tis held, And perspective that is best painter's art. For through the painter must you see his skill, To find where your true image pictured lies, Which in my bosom's shop is hanging still, That hath his windows glazed with thine eyes." DID YOU KNOW?: Shakespeare was a total Toy-Boy-Lover, marrying his beau, Anne Hathaway when he was just 17. She was 26 and carrying their first child, who was born six months after the wedding. Materials: 1.5 Inch Gold Plated engraved Cameo Locket, Gold Plated Nickel-Free Chain

name: Heart My Coffee Necklace
description:
"One more cup of coffee for the road. One more cup of coffee 'fore I go." If you are as loved-up with your morning mug of the black stuff as we are (okay, we love the mid-morning, lunchtime, afternoon, and evening brews just as much too!) then this heart-painted miniature ceramic Coffee Mug Necklace is for you!
Don't like Coffee? More of a Tea-drinker?! Then just read the above with appropriate words replaced! ;-) DID YOU KNOW?: Over 500 Billion Cups of coffee are drunk each year and over half of those are drunk at breakfast Materials: Miniature Ceramic Glazed Mug, Nickel Free Gold Plate Chain

name: Indecis Earings
description: "Oh mon amour L’amour physique est sans issue!" These stamp-embossed earings depict two of the most useful and powerful words in existence - YES and NO! If French is the language of love, then OUI et NON must be the defining words of blissfully happy or painfully dejected lovers. Whether you're accepting or spurning advances, or just need help deciding what to order at the patiserie, maybe these little wonders can help! DID YOU KNOW?: Indecisive Brigitte Bardot recorded the female vocals on lover Serge Gainsbourgh's infamous song "Je T'aime... Moi Non Plus", but later begged to be removed, and was replaced by Jane Birkin before its 1968 release! Materials: 1.5 cm Metal Discs, Nickel Free Silver Plate Wires

name: Continental Breakfast Earings
description:
"Je voudrais une croissant, Je suis enchante!" The "birth" of the croissant can be dated back to 1835, when an Austrian artillery officer, August Zang, founded a Viennese Bakery ("Boulangerie Viennoise") on rue de Richelieu in Paris. This bakery, which served Viennese specialities quickly became popular and its speciality pastry, the "Kipferl" inspired French imitators to make their own version of the buttery pastry, which they named for its crescent (croissant) shape.
These dinky china teaplates each hold a miniature croissant, made to dress up your lobes like a dolls tea party! DID YOU KNOW?: Crescent-shaped pastries have probably existed since classical times (they resembled the crescent moon or the horns of a bull, both worshipped at different times! Materials: 1 Inch Ceramic Plates, Nickel Free Posts and Butterfly Backs

name: Comic Book Bangle
description: "Can he swing from a thread? Take a look overhead!" ZZWWAPP! SPANNNG! THWUD! CLUNK! This piece is a lightweight chunky bangle, decoupaged with cutout strips of a genuine 80's comicbook, and loaded with several coats of glossy sealing varnish! The ultimate in Geek-Chic, it looks great with anything, wether you're on the beach, on a cinema date, or punching the air at a gig! DID YOU KNOW?: In 1933, Eastern Color Press, came up with the idea of printing an 8-page comic section that could be folded down from the large broadsheet to a smaller 9 inch by 12 inch format. The result was the first modern comic book! Materials: Wooden Bangle - 1.5 Inch wide with 2.5 inner diameter, Vintage comic book scraps, enamel gloss top coat ONE-OF-A-KIND - Comes complete with BUG POP One-Off Authenticity Certificate

name: Mr Moustache Necklace
description: "A lady gets a lotta things She gets a 20 carat ring She gets the alimony too She gets to look good in the nude But there's one place where they've been whipped Between the nose and upper lip " Here at Bug Pop, it is firmly believed that ALL men look better with a moustache! Truly! Queen B is a MAJOR fan, undoubtedly influenced by the FANTASTIC lip-warmer her own father sported through from the 60's to the 00's! This necklace is the perfect way to pledge your allegiance to our hairy brothers, and also the perfect size to hike up and wear as your own lady-like metallo-'tache! DID YOU KNOW?: Fireman are not allowed to have facial hair because it prevents breathing equipment from fitting properly. Materials: Plated Brass Moulding, Nickel Free Plated Chain

name: Earl Grey Necklace
description: "Earl Grey, a tea with impeccable prime ministerial credentials!" Earl Grey II was British Prime Minister from 1830 - 1834. Snubbing his Father's Tory tendencies, he fought for the people, seeing passage of the Great Reform Act 1832, which finally saw the reform of the House of Commons, and the abolition of slavery throughout the British Empire in 1833. Named after this diamond geezer, Earl Grey Tea is flavoured with bergamot oil, and is drunk by the gallon, from fine china and battered tin mugs alike at The BUG POP Headquarters! DID YOU KNOW?: There was even an Earl Grey flavoured KitKat in Japan?! Materials: (measurement) Silver Plated Chain, Ribbon, Picture Cameo, Ceramic Comes complete with numbered BUG POP Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate

These littele guys are real-man-sized humans, gorging themselves on GIANT sushi, in a Land Of The Giants type adventure. They and the sushi have just been shrunk down to the perfectly dinky wearable size for our pleasure! Geddit?! Like it?! ... Thought so! ;-) DID YOU KNOW?: The mass-production of sushi rolls was made possible by a pioneering female scientist in Britain in the 1940s. Japanese seaweed farmers have erected a shrine in her memory. Materials: Miniature Plastic Models, Nickel Free Stud Earings

artists.name: Land Of The Giants Sushi House

artists.name: Land Of The Giants Sushi House

name: Inéz Beaded Bracelet
description: "Amigo y vino, el mas antiguo." Made as part of a beaded bracelet series influenced by international girls names. The girl name Inéz is of Old Greek origin and it is predominantly used in the Spanish language. This piece hints at warm Spanish summer evenings, Mayan Gold, and Día de los Muertos celebrations. DID YOU KNOW?: In a famous ghost story, a little girl named Inez Clarke, haunts Chicago's Graceland Cemetery, around the spot where she is immortalized by a statue in a glass case. The statue, it is said, disappears now and then, and the ghost of poor Inez is seen playing around the graveyard, especially during storms. Materials: Elastic thread, Vintage and Modern Glass, Plastic, and Ceramic Beads, Ribbon Bow LIMITED EDITION - FIVE - Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Certificate!

name: Lilliputians Earings
description: "I cried in a loud voice, Long live the most puissant Emperor of Lilliput!" In the 1726 Jonathan Swift novel "Gulliver's Travels", Gulliver is washed ashore after his ship is wrecked, and awakes to find himself in Lilliput, imprisoned by its inhabitants - a race of tiny people, less than 15cm high! Taken from ex model railway kits, the tiny figures are dinky, and better behaved than the Lilliputians - They will always courtsey and bow to all the compliments they recieve whilst dangling from your lucky lobes! DID YOU KNOW?: The shortest adult human ever recorded was Indian Gul Mohammed, who measured just 56 cm! Materials: 1 Inch Plastic Figures, Nickel Free Silver Plate Wires Pair sent will be chosen at random

name: Heart My Coffee Earings
description:
"One more cup of coffee for the road. One more cup of coffee 'fore I go." If you are as loved-up with your morning mug of the black stuff as we are (okay, we love the mid-morning, lunchtime, afternoon, and evening brews just as much too!) then these heart-painted miniature ceramic Coffee Mug earings are for you!
Don't like Coffee? More of a Tea-drinker?! Then just read the above with appropriate words replaced! ;-) DID YOU KNOW?: Over 500 Billion Cups of coffee are drunk each year and over half of those are drunk at breakfast Materials: Miniature Ceramic Glazed Mugs, Nickel Free Gold Plate Wires

name: War Of The Roses Earings
description: "And every one was an Hen-er-y, She wouldn't have a Willy or a Sam!..." Who wasn't fascinated by The Tudors in primary school History class?! What a bunch of mentals! So decadent and deadly, so full of fun and fickle. Henry and his poor old selection box of headless wives, Elizabeth the fiery "Virgin Queen", "Bloody Mary" of Scotland locked away in the tower... Amazing stories! Add to that fascination Queen B's regular childhood paternal visits from Liverpool to Bradford, and a great sense of significance whenever the car passed between the official markers/diciders of Lancashire and Yorkshire - The Red and White Rose, large bright and bold stone statues. This one could go on forever... Inspiration (part) explained... Here's The War Of The Roses! DID YOU KNOW?: Anne Boylen had 11 fingers, which she hid under long sleeves, leading to the rumour that Traditional song "Greensleeves" was written about her by Henry himself Materials: Metal-Plated Charms, Vinyl Buds, Nickel Free Gold Plate Wires

name: Your Choice Charm Bracelet
description: "Uh-huh huh, you sweet delight, I want a good luck charm, a-hanging on my arm" Charms go back as far as the Neolithic era where man would pick up an unusual stone or piece of wood and carry it with him to ward off his enemies. Elaborate jewelry made of precious stones and metals emerged during the age of the Egyptian Pharaohs. It was during this time that the first recognizable charm bracelets and necklaces first appeared. Ward off your own enemies by wearing your ultimate Amulet charm, hung from a Silver Plated Bangle. Are you a Maths Brain? Choose our Silver Calculator charm for uber-geekery! Horror-nerd?! Choose the Creepy Casket coffin, or Vamp Fangs charms... Burlesquer? Then go with the godmother of Can-Can - The Moulin Rouge charm! DID YOU KNOW?: A charm is a small ornament usually dangling from a bracelet or chain. However, the Italian Charm Bracelet is configured differently. While each charm is separate and interchangeable, it lies flat against the wrist and is interlocking to the next charm, similarly to an expansion band Materials: Silver Bangle, Silver Plated Charm

name: Elevenses Pin Brooch
description:
"What about elevenses? Luncheon? Afternoon tea? Dinner? Supper? He knows about them, doesn't he?" In the United Kingdom and Ireland, elevenses is a snack that is similar to afternoon tea, but eaten in the morning. The name refers to the time of day that it is taken: around 11 am. The term is first attested, in East Anglia, 1849, as elevens.
Choose from the Bug Pop Bakery's quaint little miniature selection of a sugar-rolled donut and a finger sandwich, or a big slice of layer cake, atop a blue china plate. The perfect treat, these are way too cute to eat! DID YOU KNOW?: In 1999, enraged Magistrates of Kent, hit UK headlines when they protested to the cutting of thier Eleven a.m teabreak! Materials: 1 Inch Ceramic Plate, Plastic Food, Nickel Safety Pin

name: NEW!!! Special Commission Kilt-Pin Brooch!
description: Special Commissions are our favourite jobs! HOORAY for you! We are excited to now be offering these, the little-sister product to our popular Special Commission Charm Bracelets! Perfect for a smaller/more affordable gift, yet still totally unique and tailor-made to suit the tastes of the recipient. Please click the ORDER FORM link below to open the form in another window, then add this item to your shopping cart and checkout. When you have paid, fill in your order form in its seperate window and press send. If you encounter any problems, don't hesitate to contact us! These orders can take up to 7 days to complete due to charm sourcing. Please state if you need us to try and hurry it along sooner... FILL IN ORDER FORM HERE!! Comes with BUG POP One-Off Authenticity Certificate!

name: Special Commission Charm Bracelet!
description:
Special Commissions are our favourite jobs! HOORAY for you! And now you get to design your own!! Such a great gift for a special friend or for yourself. All the charm of a hand-crafted commission, but designed specially by you!
Just choose your bracelet cord colour, then take note of the 8 charms you would like, add to cart and pay, then click CONTACT (in the top nav menu bar) and drop us a mail stating your Name and postal address, and tell us your 8 top picks, and last of all the initial of the recipient's name - B for Bodicea, etc! These orders can take up to 14 days to complete. Please state if you need us to try and hurry it along sooner...

name: Rock Me! Neck Collar
description:
This stylish detatched collar is emblazoned with awesome hard-rock silver studs and skull! 
Pair up with any old t-shirt, vest, sweater to create a unique hard-edged cocktail look!

name: Vinyl Whirlwind Rib Cage Necklace
description: "Man, you gotta try these ribs! " An impressive net of curved and tapered bones, strong enough to protect half of one's vital organs! - The Rib Cage is such a beautiful sight that we really should get to wear one around our necks more often! This scaled down replica is bold and unusual, and bound to catch the eye of all who behold it! But only 25 of you lucky readers will ever be the proud owner of this design! Catch one while you can! DID YOU KNOW?: Introduced in the late 30's, radio commercials and prerecorded radio programs began to be sent to disc jockeys, stamped in vinyl, so they wouldn't break in the mail! Materials: 2.5 x 2 Inch Acrylic Rib Cage, 16 Inch Nickel Free Silver Plated Chain, Vintage Picture Cameo LIMITED EDITION - Twenty-five in the world - Comes with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate

name: Here Comes The Bride Charm Bracelet
description: "A kiss on the hand may be nice, but a bracelet lasts forever!" Charm bracelets are a classic jewellery item that always look good, and tell a tale. Enjoying a huge boost in Trend-Popularity in recent years, they have long been the treasured posession of women around the world - associated with love, mysticism, magic, and protection, for more than 75,000 years!!! With the charms hung from a soft black cord, this bracelet is a more casual, everyday take on the classic gold and silver bracelet. Just look closely at the charms and central picture cameo to hear its story! DID YOU KNOW?: Queen Victoria wore charm bracelets that started a fashion among the European noble classes! Materials: 7 Inch length Wax Cotton Cord, Plastic and Metal Charms and fastenings ONE-OF-A-KIND! - Comes complete with Bug Pop One-Of-A-Kind Authenticity Certificate!

name: Black Hole Kilt Pin Brooch
description: "When I volunteered for this mission, I never thought I'd end up playing straight man to a tin can. " Inspired by Queen B's recent first viewing of the classic 70's space-movie Black Hole, this charm brooch features a vintage enamel replica of big bad evil bully-boy robot, MAXIMILLIAN! Check out our friend's crazy Roman Avant Noise-Punk band named after the villian himself! DID YOU KNOW?: According to press at the time, John Barry's Black Hole score was the world's first digitally recorded soundtrack. Materials: 2.5 Inch Silver Plated Kilt Pin, Metal and Enamel Charms, Plated Metal Chains, Glass Bead LIMITED EDITION - FIVE IN THE WORLD - Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate!

name: A Sailor's Life For Me Earings (Blue)
description: "The first mate he got drunk, an broke in the Captain's trunk!" These statement earings are lightweight, and flutter as you move, like a flag at sea! Nautical imagery seems to come into fashion more often than any other. We don't care if it's in or out with the fashionistas, BUG POP always loves anything to bring up thoughts of a life at sea! Wear these with pretty much any outfit, be it pirate stripes and skulls, blue denim, a little black dress or a classic floral print! Match up with our Country Girl Hair Slides for a cute retro two-piece accessory look. DID YOU KNOW?: The world’s largest ship of any kind is a French oil tanker, the "Pierre Guillaumat", which weighs 554,000 tons! Materials: 1 Inch Plastic Charms, Cotton Bows, Nickel Free Silver Plate ear wires

name: Pearly Girl Earings
description: "If I gave you diamonds and pearls, would you be a happy boy or a girl?" The birthstone for June, pearls are often considered to bring good luck. Historically, the glowing white orbs have been associated with the moon and are thought to symbolize purity, innocence, faith, and honesty. They have also been a symbol of wealth and refinement, and no, sorry, these are not real pearls, but large vintage plastic replicas. Fear not!- bonafide gems or not, they look great, and still add that touch of class to any lass! DID YOU KNOW?: The largest and most expensive pearl ever to be found is known as the "Pearl of Lao Tzu," measuring 9.45 inches in diameter and tipping the scales at 14.1lbs! It is valued at nearly 60 million dollars! Materials: 1 Inch Plastic Figures, Nickel Free Silver Plate Wires

name: Chiyo Jigsaw Puzzle Piece Necklace
description: "Me, I'm waiting so patiently, lying on the floor. I'm just trying to do this jig-saw puzzle, before it rains anymore !" John Spilsbury, a London mapmaker and engraver, is credited with commercialising jigsaw puzzles around 1760. BUG POP has always been a bit too distractable to sit down and finish one, but loves to save the lives of otherwise-doomed "20 parts missing" puzzles, and transform them. Every single piece makes a unique One-Of-A-Kind treasure! This puzzle piece originates from a huge 1960's puzzle, with a Japanese garden scene print! DID YOU KNOW?: Up until about 1880, jigsaw puzzles were known as... Dissections! Materials: 18 Inch Silver Plated Chain, Vintage Wooden Jigsaw Piece ONE-OF-A-KIND- Comes complete with BUG POP One-Of-A-Kind Authenticity Certificate!

name: Roman Holiday Necklace
description: "Joe, we can't go running around town with a hot princess! " BUG POP picked up a small handfull of these vintage picture charms when holidaying in Rome in the summer of 2010. If you are a hopeless romantic and haven't seen the 1953 classic "Roman Holiday", starring Gregory Peck and Audrey Hepburn, then add it to your list! The film's bittersweet story is a charming romantic-comedy, a reverse Cinderella story. On a royal visit to the Italian capital, a bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman. DID YOU KNOW?: The scene in "Roman Holiday" where Joe (Gregory Peck) pretends that his hand was bitten off in the Bocca Di Veritas was improvised by Peck, and thus Audrey Hepburn's shock and laughter are for real! Materials: (measurement) Silver Plated Chain, Vintage Picture Cameo Comes complete with BUG POP Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate

name: Puss-In-Boots Rib Cage Necklace
description: "Once upon a time a poor old man died and left his only three possessions to his three sons. The oldest boy got his mill, the second got his donkey and the youngest one got his cat... " An impressive net of curved and tapered bones, strong enough to protect half of one's vital organs! - The Rib Cage is such a beautiful sight that we really should get to wear one around our necks more often! This scaled down replica is bold and unusual, and bound to catch the eye of all who behold it! But only 25 of you lucky readers will ever be the proud owner of this design! Catch one while you can! DID YOU KNOW?: Adam Ants top 5 song "Puss 'n Boots" was produced by Phil Collins, and had a video so raunchy it was banned by the BBC! Materials: 2.5 x 2 Inch Acrylic Rib Cage, 16 Inch Nickel Free Silver Plated Chain, Vintage Picture Cameo LIMITED EDITION - Twenty-five in the world - Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate

name: Queenie Bracelet
description: "Won't someone tell me who's the queen standin over by the record machine" Made as part of a beaded bracelet series influenced by international girls names. English Girls name "Queenie" derives from a pet form of the affectionate nickname 'Queen'. The word is sourced from the Old English 'cwen', meaning 'woman'. The name reached peak popularity in 1916 and 1922 DID YOU KNOW?: Top ranked Google search result for "Queenie" is the Wikipedia page of the superbly sulky Queen Elizabeth I character in British comedy gold series Blackadder II! Materials: Elastic thread, Vintage and Modern Glass, Plastic, and Ceramic Beads, Ribbon Bow LIMITED EDITION - FIVE - Comes complete with BUG POP Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate!

name: Tail Feather Earings
description: "Come on let me see ya shake your tailfeather! " Well everyone’s all aflutter over feathers! According to those who know, feather jewellery is the big craze for Summer, whether its real feathers or jewellery in the shape of feathers. Glam yourself up with these beautifully delicate replicas, topped with clear purple, and shiny pearly beads. DID YOU KNOW?: The longest feathers of a wild bird belong to the Crested Argus Pheasant (Rheinhartia ocellata) which commonly reach lengths of 173cm! Materials: 1 Inch Enamel Charms, Glass Pearl Beads, Nickel Free Ear Wire

name: Harauka Jigsaw Puzzle Piece Necklace
description: "Me, I'm waiting so patiently, lying on the floor. I'm just trying to do this jig-saw puzzle, before it rains anymore !" John Spilsbury, a London mapmaker and engraver, is credited with commercialising jigsaw puzzles around 1760. Miss BUG POP has always been a bit too distractable to sit down and finish one, but she loves to save the lives of otherwise-doomed "20 parts missing" puzzles, and transform them. Every single piece makes a unique One-Of-A-Kind treasure! This puzzle piece originates from a huge 1960's puzzle, with a Japanese garden scene print! DID YOU KNOW?: Up until about 1880, jigsaw puzzles were known as... Dissections! Materials: 18 Inch Ox Brass Plated Chain, Vintage Wooden Jigsaw Piece ONE-OF-A-KIND! Comes complete with BUG POP One-Of-A-Kind Authenticity Certificate!

name: Underwater Love Charm Bracelet
description: "A kiss on the hand may be nice, but a bracelet lasts forever!" Charm bracelets are a classic jewellery item that always look good, and tell a tale. Enjoying a huge boost in Trend-Popularity in recent years, they have long been the treasured posession of women around the world - associated with love, mysticism, magic, and protection, for more than 75,000 years!!! With the charms hung from a bright aqua-marine blue cord, this bracelet is a more casual, everyday take on the classic gold and silver bracelet. Just look closely at the charms and central picture cameo to hear its story! DID YOU KNOW?: Queen Victoria wore charm bracelets that started a fashion among the European noble classes! Materials: 7 Inch length Wax Cotton Cord, Plastic and Metal Charms and fastenings ONE-OF-A-KIND! - Comes complete with Bug Pop One-Of-A-Kind Authenticity Certificate!

name: Good Luck Keyring
description: "Go and wake up your luck! " Whether going on a journey, taking a gamble in life, leaving a job or city behind, or taking on a new commitment, many people around the world feel comforted at such times by the possession of Good Luck charms. This keyring, sporting a Lucky Black Cat, Four Leafed Clover, and Lucky Dice, is the perfect gift to add to a new house key, first car key, or just to hang somewhere to bring luck at home. DID YOU KNOW?: Thespian superstition has it that a black cat in the audience on opening night forecasts a successful play!... (C'mon, how likely is that?!) Materials: Silver tone Keyring, Gold tone and plastic charm pendants

name: Country Girl Hair Slides
description: "Fell in love with a country girl, morning sunshine she was up from a nether world..." Pretty little bows in red and blue gingham, but no fiddly bow-tying, these just slide into place, and stay there! Calling up images of vintage childrens book illustrations, and the Little House On The Prarie girls feeding the chickens before chapel! These also make for a more girly take on the 1960's Mod, Fred Perry style obsession with this pattern! DID YOU KNOW?: The name "Gingham" originates from an adjective in the Malay language, "Ging-Gang", meaning striped! Materials: Materials: 1 Inch Cotton Bows, Silver Plated Strong Grip Hair Barettes

name: Hearse Necklace
description: "E-evil eye beyond sty and sky, Hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse!" Pop Trivia - Which 80's U.K. Anarcho-Punk band released a song called Cosmic Hearse, featuring the above lyrics?! Answers on the back of a postcard! This heavy cast pewter charm is perfect for any discerning Cellar Dweller or Graveyard Groupie! DID YOU KNOW?: "Don't Fear The Reaper" by Blue Oyster Cult was the bands only Top 20 hit in England in 1978. Materials: 18 Inch Silver Plated Chain, Pewter Charm

name: Real Harmonica Necklace
description: "The only way I can play is if I get my car going really fast, and stick it out the window." The harmonica originated in China, as the Sheng, and was further developed in Europe early in the 1900's. German Matthias Hohner introuduced the harmonica to 19th century America. Cheap and portable, the instrument was perfect for a country on the move, like America back then. Miss BUG POP's own Pa is a whizz at the Harmonica and taught her the basics when she was young. She hasn't got much past there, but enjoys a regular toot nontheless! Notable mention and fan-worship goes from BUG POP to Ennio Morricone's "Man With A Harmonica" and everything recorded by Sonny Terry! <3 DID YOU KNOW?: The world's first Harmonica University was set up online in China in 2006! Go see! http://www.kouqin.com.cn/ Materials: (measurement) Silver Plated Chain, Real Working Miniature Harmonica, (PLEASE NOTE: Now sold on a plain chain without bird charm detail!)

name: Senorita Keyring
description: "On that sunny day didn’t know I’d meet, such a beautiful girl walking down the street ..." YES! We just quoted The Trouser-Snake! This one is a beautiful vintage image of a Spanish senorita from a cigarette card, and a mexican DOTD charm. Keyrings make a great affordable gift for your classy girlfriends who only wear "proper" precious jewellery or for the man who seems to have everything. And they will see this and think of you every day when they put their key in the ignition, or arrive home from work. DID YOU KNOW?: The largest collection of keychains belongs to Brent Dixon of Valdosta, Georgia, USA, with 41,418 non-duplicated key chains, which he has been collecting since 2001. Materials: Silver tone Keyring, Silver tone pendants

name: Aurelie Beaded Bracelet
description: "Aurélies Akzent ist ohne Frage sehr charmant" Made as part of a beaded bracelet series influenced by international girls names. This one inspired particularly by the personal style of the lovely Aurelie, when her boyfriend commissioned BUG POP! to make her a birthday present in reds/oranges, monochrome and lots of wood! Popular French Girls name "Aurelie" is the feminine form of the Latin Aurelius (golden), a name derived from aurum (gold). Websites that say they know, say that Aurelie reached it's highest popular use ranking for babies in 1905 and 2006! DID YOU KNOW?: In 2003, Berlin rock band "Wir Sind Helden" reached number 47 in the German charts with their single "Aurelie", as quoted above! (Trans - "Aurelie's accent is very charming, no doubt about that!") Materials: Elastic thread, Vintage and Modern Glass, Plastic, and Ceramic Beads Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Certificate

name: Mexican DOTD Kilt Pin Brooch
description: "Death is a natural part of life. Rejoice for those around you who transform into the Force. " In Mexico's Dia De Los Muertos, people build Day of the Dead altars in their homes, adorned with candy skulls, marigolds, chocolate coffins, papier-mache skeletons and photographs of the deceased. They also offer up their dead relative's favorite food and even their vices, such as cigarettes and tequila, to entice them to return for the night! See who you can tempt back with this, your own candy striped, citrus bright concoction of calavera goodness!! DID YOU KNOW?: Flowers play an important role in the celebration of the Day of the Dead, especially Mexican marigolds. It is believed that this type of flower has the power to attract the dead. Materials: 2.5 Inch Silver Plated Kilt Pin, Metal and Enamel Charms, Plated Metal Chains, Glass Beads LIMITED EDITION - FIVE IN THE WORLD - Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Authenticity Certificate!

name: Yellow Mahjong Bracelet
description: "At the gambling table, there are no Fathers and Sons" Part of a Unique Mahjong piece bracelet series. A game of skill, strategy and calculation, Mahjong is a gambling game that involves a certain degree of chance. These drilled Mahjong tiles are the perfect choice for any Asiaphile, or person who likes to take gambles in life. DID YOU KNOW?: The goal of classic Mahjong is to make as many matches as possible. If you match two free tiles, they are removed from the board. When the board is cleared, Mahjong is solved. Materials: Elastic thread, Plastic Mahjong Tiles, Plastic Beads, Glass Pearls Comes complete with BUG POP Numbered Limited Edition Certificate

name: Her And Her Hearse Earings
description: "E-evil eye beyond sty and sky, Hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse hearse!" Pop Trivia - Which 80's U.K. Anarcho-Punk band released a song called Cosmic Hearse, featuring the above lyrics?! Answers on the back of a postcard! These Gold-tone pewter charm earings are the ultimate Bling for any discerning Cellar Dweller or Graveyard Groupie! DID YOU KNOW?: Hearses in other cultures tend to be different colors. In eastern cultures, for example, white and gold hearses are common! Materials: Pewter Charms, Gold-tone Nickel Free ear wire

name: Rib Cage Pocket Watch
description: "Dem bones, dem bones, gonna walk around" The human rib surrounds the chest cavity like a cage and provides support for the pectoral girdle (shoulder) and is a core section of the human skeleton. There are typically 24 ribs in the human body with 12 on the left side and 12 on the right. This striking rib cage provides the protective sage for this real fully working glass-fronted pocket watch, hung from a long dark bronze chain. DID YOU KNOW?: On BBC Doctor Who, The Doctor has a pocket watch and says "It holds the memories of a Time Lord when in human form and when opened it will reinstate the owner to their natural form. Materials: Fully Working Wind-Up Watch, Nickel Free Gold Plate Chain
